title: Brexit Files Briefing Call – October 11
text:
The Brexit process appears to be approaching another moment when immovable object meets irresistible force.

Boris Johnson says he wants a Brexit deal, but there is extreme scepticism in Brussels and European capitals that one can be achieved. Even if it is, few have confidence he can get it through a fractious UK parliament.

That would leave the British prime minister attempting a last-minute negotiation among leaders at the October European Council summit, something they have said they will not do. If a deal fails, then Johnson is compelled by legislation to seek an extension to the Article 50 negotiating period, something Johnson has vowed he will never do.

POLITICO’s expert Brexit team on both sides of the Channel will pick their way through the noise ahead of the Council summit in this live Brexit briefing call — exclusively for Pro subscribers.

Not a Brexit Pro subcriber but are interested in attending? Please email pro@politico.eu.
